description: Unique identifier of the part category record; serves as the primary key.
Audit timestamp for when the record was created or last updated (YYYYMMDDHHMMSSmmm).
Business name of the part category used in catalogs and reports.
Identifier linking to a parent or subcategory in the hierarchy; likely a self-referential key; confirm with SME.
Legacy system identifier retained for migration and cross-referencing.
Name of the legacy system table associated with the legacy identifier.
Category classification controlling inventory behavior (e.g., consumable vs. durable) and process rules.
Indicates whether items may involve a core charge and return process.
Indicates whether size attributes are tracked for items in this category.
Indicates whether color attributes are tracked for items in this category.
Indicates whether supporting documents are tracked or required for items in this category.
Indicates whether Safety Data Sheets (SDS/MSDS) apply and are tracked.
Indicates whether OEM cross-references or manufacturer part numbers are tracked.
Indicates whether the category applies to tools and tool-related inventory.
Indicates whether the category applies to tires and tire-related inventory.
Indicates whether the category applies to fluids such as oils or coolants.
Indicates whether the category applies to fuel products.
Indicates whether items can be issued to assets, employees, or work orders.
Indicates whether items are allowed to be added to work orders.
Operational flag that core handling is enabled by default for this category; relationship to has_core may differ; confirm with SME.
Inactive status flag; when enabled, the category is hidden or blocked from use.
